channel.title: 2021-05-07 SocialCG Meeting
channel.description:
Per [the wiki](https://www.w3.org/wiki/SocialCG#Meetings) and [the calendar ](https://cloud.w3c.social/apps/calendar/p/GzxsDfE6CKtp9MHX/dayGridMonth/now), this meeting will be at:
* 5pm UTC * 1pm EDT * 10am PDT
[date=2021-05-07 time=17:00:00 timezone="UTC"] → [date=2021-05-07 time=18:00:00 timezone="UTC"]
# Agenda:
* 5min - quick introductions/reintroductions * 5min - @bengo - PROPOSAL: move Saturday meetings later to accommodate restful Saturday mornings (and attendance) for US time zones like PDT. Ranked choice https://socialhub.activitypub.rocks/t/proposal-rank-choice-meeting-times-for-the-weekend-socialcg-meeting/1713 * 15min - @grishka's [questions](https://socialhub.activitypub.rocks/t/2021-05-07-socialcg-meeting/1697/2?u=bengo) * 15min - Capability Negotiation update [from last meeting](https://socialhub.activitypub.rocks/t/2021-05-01-fediverse-interest-group-meeting/1649/23) * 20min - free-form
# Candidate Agenda Items
Please reply below to propose an agenda item. Please consider doing some ahead-of-time work to articulate the item, and linking it in your proposal so others can come prepared to build consensus or raise objections that we can discuss in our limited time together.
## Example Agenda Proposal
> PROPOSAL: @bengo - 5min - quick introductions, reintroductions (<= 30 seconds each)
Read [this for more on agendas ](https://theanarchistlibrary.org/library/c-t-butler-and-amy-rothstein-on-conflict-and-consensus-a-handbook-on-formal-consensus-decisionm#toc62).
### [Meeting URL](https://bbb.w3c.social/b/rhi-vp1-fv6-vn7)

item.title: 2021-05-07 SocialCG Meeting
item.dc:creator: naturzukunft
item.description:
@grishka I also have that issue. I currently testing to provide a SPARQL Endpoint to a actors store.
I’m 99,9% sure, that our AP Implementation will provide SPARQL.
My solution uses rdf4j.

item.title: 2021-05-07 SocialCG Meeting
item.dc:creator: codenamedmitri
item.description:
PROPOSAL: @codenamedmitri - 5min - Summarize previous meetings’ conversation about SocialCG Issue Trackers. (Short version: There is no one issue tracker, but several. And there’s the FEP process.)

See:

  • RESOLUTION: This is currently the primary issue tracker for SWICG · Issue #27 · swicg/general · GitHub (No resolution; issue closed)
  • Social CG Issue Trackers ← existing issue tracker list and recommendations.

Read full topic

See this forum topic for ranked choice ballot or any objections. PROPOSAL: Rank choice meeting times for the weekend SocialCG Meeting

item.title: 2021-05-07 SocialCG Meeting
item.dc:creator: bengo
item.description:
grishka:

We need to think of a way to query a remote collection to determine whether it contains an item without downloading the whole thing. This could be useful in a number of different ways — like getting an authoritative response on whether a wall post was accepted, or whether someone is someone else’s friend.

SPARQL?
LDP lightly mentions Sparql in 5.1.1.
Sorting/ordering is also kind of relevant to querying, see LDP-Paging.

This is another proposed way of querying: Linked Data Fragments | Concept

  • e.g. query for the triple “[container] [ldp:contains] [item]”

Read full topic

item.title: 2021-05-07 SocialCG Meeting
item.dc:creator: aschrijver
item.description:
8 posts were split to a new topic: Smithereen now has Masonry Image layout

Read full topic

item.title: 2021-05-07 SocialCG Meeting
item.dc:creator: Sebastian
item.description:
In this week @redaktor.me implemented support for the native CSS masonry grid layout with the minimal possible JS fallback and blurhash !!! (!)

That is so boring that I would like to talk about “Link Relations” and if we find the time a quick continuation about open points in “Capability Negotiation”

seeAlso

Continuation of the meetings waitlist SocialCG
In the last meetings, the group was able to debate and resolve a number of points, we long wanted to speak about. The last meeting was very productive about Capability Negotiation and the Discovery of features … However, there are some points remaining and let’s list them here alsoKnownAs and Link Relations Following up on Defining alsoKnownAs - #9 by Sebastian @rhiaro but also on the adhoc discussion in SocialCG IRC [sorry for the mess] Capability Negotiation If this would end in an FE…

Read full topic

item.title: 2021-05-07 SocialCG Meeting
item.dc:creator: grishka
item.description:
I’d like to discuss ActivityPub collections and my FEP, again.

  • Whether I should move forward with the Accept{…} activity as an acknowledgement for something being added to a publicly-appendable collection.
  • We need to think of a way to query a remote collection to determine whether it contains an item without downloading the whole thing. This could be useful in a number of different ways — like getting an authoritative response on whether a wall post was accepted, or whether someone is someone else’s friend.

Read full topic
